part.name: bathroom
part.narration: Yuki stands in the bathroom, across from the bottle of hair dye on the vanity mirror. From another room, Jacques goes on about his first day at Sega.
part.line: ...and a Frenchwoman actually came to apply for a position. Naturally, they had me interview her.
It was so awkward; she sounded like a robot.
part.narration: In the bathroom, Yuki walks towards the oh-so-necessary bottle.The bottle of hair dye is brought to the player's attention. Continue when the player gets closer to the vanity mirror.
part.line: I must do this.
I must belong.
It's the only way to survive.
It's the only way to be loved.
part.narration: Yuki raises the bottle. Jacques continues.If the player presses the Main Action button here, Yuki cowers.
part.line: She said she was a cinematographer, so I told her the only thing that would make sense:
"A friend of the film industry is an enemy of mine."
part.narration: Yuki puts down the bottle. Why did she so deeply agree with that statement?

part.name: cannes_end
part.narration: Sudden cut to Yuki, younger, in a different bathroom.1994. Black Beauty is but one hair product amongst a sea of hair products used by The Actresses of the film industry. Yuki, in her pajamas, gazes at that sea. She puts down the bottle.Over each hair product appears rapidly changing vision text.Asami, from in the bedroom, calls.
part.line: Daughter, time for bed!
part.narration: Asami is seated on the edge of the bed. Yuki enters the room and jumps on. Asami pats her on the head.
part.line: You caused quite the scene today.
part.narration: Yuki laughs. Someone forcefully knocks the bedroom door.
part.line: Come in.
part.narration: Enter Someone. He keeps a piece of stapled paper so close to his face as to obscure it. Asami raises a brow.
part.line: What's wrong?
part.narration: Someone reads:
part.line: Dr. Takeshi, We deeply regret that we cannot allow you further visit to Cannes.
part.narration: Asami rises from her seating, the facets of vexation accumulating within her gait and on her visage—
part.line: Cut the formal bullshit and tell me the problem, you have your own voice.
For God's sake, we're partners.
Are we? Partners work together.
You haven't been in any credits of any film for the past seven years.
On top of that, your conduct has been inexcusable.
Explain.
part.narration: The Someone moves up the paper.
part.line: 1987, you arrived nine months pregnant.
My score was in an entry!
You went into labor on stage!
part.narration: Summer rains pelt the hotel windows. The winds drive palm tree leaves to brush against each other. This Someone moves up the paper.
part.line: 1994, you brought a seven year old.
Come on, don't do this.
She undressed an actress on camera.
None of that is my conduct!
part.narration: Silence. Yuki mopes. The Someone moves up the paper.
part.line: Apple strays not far from the tree.
There is a level of sophistication, of class, that we must uphold.
You have made no effort to uphold it.
part.narration: The Someone flips to page two.
part.line: You are freeloading from Cannes to provide a publicity platform your stage career.
No more.
part.narration: The Someone leaves. An unbearable silence falls over the room. Asami stands in place, staring at the ground, face obscured by hair, for a near-eternity. She raises her hand.
part.line: Yuki, come.
part.narration: So Yuki comes. Asami raises her fists, turns around, charges at Yuki, and halts. Yuki winces.

Asami falls to her knees. She places her hands upon Yuki's shoulders. A great regret resides upon her face. Quickly returns her frightening resolve. The mother sheds a tear and shuts her eyes. Across the cheek, Asami strikes her child.Upon impact, sudden shift back to the bathroom.

part.name: japan_back
part.narration: 1997. Yuki stumbles and jumps and snatches the bottle from the table and she opens it and rattles it above her hair.The main action is used here. The player is the one shaking the bottle. The only option is to shake it more vigorously until the dye comes out— Dust. Yuki pants.
part.line: What —
part.narration: The Player is expected to move the cursor close to Yuki. Yuki signifies the Player of this by pointing at the cursor (which lights up as well), and coaxing it over while she looks at the camera. The Player must zoom into the bottle to get a look at it in detail. This is an early sign of the collaborative relationship between the avatar and the Player.Yuki looks up at the bottle's manufacture date.

It is too late to go out and buy that fresh new bottle of liquid hope. School starts tomorrow.To signify the extremely fast passing of time, entities of the bathroom begin to morph into entities of the classroom. Everything violently flies around, crossing Yuki's path, hitting her, knocking her over, surprising her. The bathroom drawer morphs into a desk and tumbles into its designated place. The carpet becomes a clock and flips everything on it, dashing to the wall. The wall-tiles fly off and reveal the sky: it's a window. The vanity mirror becomes a chalkboard.
part.line: No, no, no!
I look too different! I look too wrong!
I look —
part.narration: Class is in session. Yuki examines the unfamiliar heads of the room. All of them are Black Beauties.
part.line: Not Japanese.
